instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936 green light OK, PPBUS _G3H 3.46V
threads.message:
Hello guys,

someone tried to change the battery on a 820-2936 MacBook with a fake one and now it does not start. I get a green light in the charger but PPBUS_G3H is 3.46V.

On ILS chip U7000 I measure resistance 17/18 3.2Ohm and 27/28 is 20.4Ohm.

What do I measure first?

threads.title: 820-2936 green light OK, PPBUS _G3H 3.46V
threads.message:
First, diode mode to ground at L7030.
Next some voltages for U7000; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 15, 19, 20.

Try to start in SMC bypass mode.
Do not connect battery again, untill get the board working on charger only...

threads.title: 820-2936 green light OK, PPBUS _G3H 3.46V
threads.message:
So, Diode mode to ground at L7030 is 0.442V

U7000 pins measures:

pin 1 0.003V 

pin 2 16.34V 

pin 3 3.93V 

pin 9 0.028V 

pin 12 3.469V 

pin 13 3.437V

Pin 15 0.047V

Pin 19 5.03V

Pin 20 5.03V

How do I start in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: 820-2936 green light OK, PPBUS _G3H 3.46V
threads.message:
Remove F7040 and check L7030 voltage.
Also check in diode mode SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: 820-2936 green light OK, PPBUS _G3H 3.46V
threads.message:
Removed F7040 and in L7030 voltage is 3.81V

In diode mode:

SDA 0.491v

SCL 0.477v

threads.title: 820-2936 green light OK, PPBUS _G3H 3.46V
threads.message:
Check again, you have too big difference; should be less than 1%.
If still bad, remove D6950 and check again.
Also disconnect BIL connector.
Next step, if needed, remove ISL6259.
If still difference, SMC is the last option...

threads.title: 820-2936 green light OK, PPBUS _G3H 3.46V
threads.message: Post voltages for 5v1 CHGR, CHGR DCIN and CHGR ACIN.  If all present, this sounds like a bad ISL...

threads.title: 820-2936 green light OK, PPBUS _G3H 3.46V
threads.message: Yep! Probably bad ISL... Crappy Chinese batteries always fry that chip!
